qas.question: From the 2011 census, London is second in population in the EU to which city?
During what time did London have the world's largest population, city-wise?
Approximately how many languages are spoken in the Greater London area?
As of mid-2014, London's population forms what percentage of the entire United Kingdom population?
What is the population of metropolitan London?

context: London has a diverse range of peoples and cultures, and <a2_0>more than 300<a2_0/> languages are spoken within Greater London. The Office for National Statistics estimated its mid-2014 population to be 8,538,689, the largest of any municipality in the European Union, and accounting for <a3_0>12.5<a3_0/> percent of the UK population. London's urban area is the second most populous in the EU, after <a0_0>Paris<a0_0/>, with 9,787,426 inhabitants according to the 2011 census. The city's metropolitan area is one of the most populous in Europe with <a4_0>13,879,757<a4_0/> inhabitants,[note 4] while the Greater London Authority states the population of the city-region (covering a large part of the south east) as 22.7 million. London was the world's most populous city from <a1_0>around 1831 to 1925<a1_0/>.
